oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: UNICEF tour - New Zealand - 1972 - part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part one of a 1972 UNICEF fundraiser tour performance in New Zealand. Featuring Tex Ritter (host), Glenn Barber (performer), and a performance of a traditional Maori welcome song, as performed by unidentified Maori performers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Glenn Barber
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening statements ([Unidentified]) -- (00:55) [Unidentified] introduces the show and a group of Maori performers -- (01:35) [Unidentified traditional Maori welcome song] ([Unidentified Maori performers]) -- (05:10) [Unidentified] introduces Tex Ritter -- (05:31) Tex Ritter accepts the Maori presentation -- (05:45) Tex Ritter talks about being welcomed by the Maori people of New Zealand, and the performers who have come with him on this tour -- (07:20) Tex Ritter talks about just having arrived from Australia, and after New Zealand they travel to Japan -- (08:10) Ritter talks about a future fundraising effort for UNICEF and political problems around the world like poverty -- (09:24) Tex Ritter introduces Glenn Barber -- (10:21) Glenn Barber talks and introduces the first tune -- (10:45) Don't Worry 'Bout The Mule (Just Load The Wagon) [Glenn Barber] -- (13:22) Glenn Barber talks about country music and has the audience applaud it -- (13:54) Glenn Barber introduces the next tune -- (14:53) Honey (Glenn Barber) -- (16:26) Barber thanks the audience and talks about Willie Nelson -- (17:28) Touch Me (Willie Nelson) -- (19:05) Barber thanks the audience, talks about country music and Marty Robbins, and introduces his last tune -- (20:10) My Woman, My Woman, My Wife (Glenn Barber)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex, 1905-1974; Barber, Glenn; UNICEF.;
